title: Night paddle to the dome and back
text:
Distance: 11.6 km
Strava

Evening paddle to Spanish city and back with Paul, Sarah, Will, Gordon and Geoff. It was cold but calm and the half moon lit the sky well enough to see without our torches. Although we did turn our lights on for the small section in the River Tyne to keep the port authority happy.
When we got to Spanish City, myself Sarah and Paul decided to head back while the others continued on to the lighthouse. It can be really quite disorienting paddling at night. Sometimes it felt like we were travelling much faster than we actually were other times large waves would creep up on us. Had a hot chocolate the rowing club and then headed back home tired but very happy to have a squeezed in an excellent midweek paddle in February.

title: North to table rocks
text:
Distance: 11.9 km
Strava

Paul, Kev, Claire, Cath, Mark and Gordon Dave setting off a little late and meeting us on the water.
High tide and not much swell
Tide was ebbing as we came around the piers which meant a little effort was needed to get back into the mouth.
We put a little speed on for the sprint along the wall and into the Haven
üì∏: Kev Thompson

title: South to Marsden
text:
Distance: 10 km
Strava

Making the most of evening light we headed South tonight (Paul, Sarah, Cath, Claire, Kev, Mark). Chased the DFDS out between the piers. Slight tide race off the North pier.
Quite choppy and a good height (5m) for playing in rock gardens between Trow & Marsden.
Two Shields youths entertained themselves by throwing rocks at us üôÑ
Mick caught us up for some rock hopping before we headed back around South pier at sunset.

title: Essential WSKF day 1: Rescues in the wind
text:
Distance: 9.3 km
Strava

title: About
text:
Hello, I‚Äôm Rhi! üëãüèª This is a personal paddle log to collate my paddling reports and reflect on personal development. I started paddling in 2019. I occasionally paddle whitewater and lakes, but heart lies with sea kayaking.

My Clubs
I currently paddle with a number of local clubs:

Tynemouth Paddlesports Club
Wansbeck Paddlesports Club
Lakeland Canoe Club
Cumbria Canoeists

I have previously been a member of:

Lancaster & District Canoe Club
Ulverston Canoe Club



My Boats

Romany Classic (Red)
Liquid Logic Hefe Chico (Yellow)



My Qualifications

Sea Kayak Award
Paddlesport Instuctor (Kayak)
CNTP
VHF SRC
FSRT

title: Will paddle for chips
text:
Distance: 8.5 km
Strava

Just me, Paul and Sarah out for a short paddle before the swimming pool session. I had really bad cramps and it hurt to sit in an upright paddling position so I paddled very slowly. It was low spring tide and so a lot of the pier that I couldn‚Äôt normally see was exposed. Followed by chips at Oswins üòã

title: The fog cleared
text:
Distance: 18.1 km
Strava

Initially the fog was heavy, and we considered just paddling North, rather than cross the channel in the fog. However, by the time we were getting on the water, the fog burnt off.
We stopped for lunch at Souter point. On the paddle back a mega wave broke near the arch.
With Paul, Sarah, Dave, Gail, Tim, Tony, Mark, Pauline.

title: Surrounded by seals
text:
Distance: 10.1 km
Strava

First Coquet island trip of the year. The seals came out to play and we were surrounded whilst they played with our toggles. Ann & Pauline headed back after lap one whilst Kirstie and I went around for a second time.
Afterwards we got chips at Amble and watched the eider ducks dive for their lunch. Saw some curlews and avocets in the estuary too. üì∏ @kmacventures

title: Bwa Du a Bwa Gwyn
text:
Distance: 12.1 km
Strava

The day after our tidal race course, Paul, Sarah and I did a short paddle from Porch Dafach.
Paul Williams suggested that the arches Bwa Du & Bwa Gwyn were worth a look.
I practised my navigation skills on the way home as Porth Dafarch isn‚Äôt obvious to spot.
